title: 106_s108
content: SECTION 1. PROJECT FOR NAVIGATION, WELLS HARBOR, MAINE. The project for navigation at Wells Harbor, Maine is modified to realign the channel and anchorage areas for 150 craft capacity. Certain portions of the project are deauthorized after the enactment of this Act. The project at Wells Harbor, Maine is modified to realign the channel and anchorage areas for 150 craft capacity. Certain portions of the project are deauthorized after the enactment of this Act. The boundaries of different sections are described with specific coordinates and directions. The project at Wells Harbor, Maine involves realigning the channel and anchorage areas for 150 craft capacity. Specific coordinates and directions are provided for different sections of the project. The boundaries of a 10-foot settling basin are outlined with detailed measurements and points. The project at Wells Harbor, Maine involves realigning the channel and anchorage areas for 150 craft capacity. Specific coordinates and directions are provided for different sections of the project, including the redesignation of portions as part of the 6-foot anchorage with detailed measurements and points. The project at Wells Harbor, Maine involves realigning the channel and anchorage areas for 150 craft capacity. Specific coordinates and directions are provided for different sections of the project, including the redesignation of portions as part of the 6-foot anchorage with detailed measurements and points. The boundaries of the 10-foot inner harbor settling basin are outlined with specific coordinates and distances for each section. The project at Wells Harbor, Maine involves realigning the channel and anchorage areas for 150 craft capacity. Specific coordinates and directions are provided for different sections of the project, including the redesignation of portions as part of the 6-foot anchorage with detailed measurements and points. The 6-foot anchorage area described in subsection (c)(3) will be realigned to include the area south of the inner harbor settling basin. The inner harbor settling basin may be relocated to the outer harbor between the jetties. The Secretary of the Interior can enforce a conservation easement on the project. The State of Maine has an obligation to enforce a conservation easement over land owned by the town of Wells, adjacent to the Rachel Carson National Wildlife Refuge.
